Runes, a game created by Víctor Álvarez Romero

Runes is a game where two powerful mages fight in an intense duel. Players have a wide range of spells at their disposal with very different effects. Each of them has a rune associated, and the players will have to draw it in the touch screen so they can unleash their power.

Normal: The game ... by turns. One of the players is the attacker and the other one is the defender. The attacker chooses the spell he wants to cast and then both players will have to draw its associated rune. Taking into account the time needed to draw it and how much precission they had, each player will get a score. The higher score wins the round. If the attacker wins, he casts the spell successfully and a new turn begins with him as the attacker again. On the other hand, if the defender is the winner he makes the enemy spell take no effect and in the next turn he will be the attacker. The game goes on until one of the mages has his life reduced to 0.
Hardcore: In this game mode there are no turns. The players cast their spells as fast as possible. The precission when drawing the runes determines the effectiveness of the spell.
